member.name: T:Infragistics.Documents.Word.AnchorsCollection
member.summary: Contains the anchored content for the associated Paragraph.

remarks.p: A picture which is anchored to a specific location within the document can be added to the paragraph using the AddAnchoredPicture method.
A shape which is anchored to a specific location within the document can be added to the paragraph using the AddAnchoredShape method.

Text, hyperlinks, images, and shapes can be added to a paragraph using the ContentRuns collection. Content which belongs to this collection does not occupy a static location within the document, but rather changes position as other content is added or removed.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Documents.Word.ContentRunsCollection
member.summary: Contains the inline content for the associated Paragraph, such as text, hyperlinks, inline pictures, and inline shapes.

remarks.p: A run of text can be added to the paragraph using the AddTextRun method.
A hyperlink can be added to the paragraph using the AddHyperlink method.
A picture which appears inline with textual content can be added to the paragraph using the AddInlinePicture method.
A shape which appears inline with textual content can be added to the paragraph using the AddInlineShape method.

"Inline" content is defined as content whose position within the document changes dynamically as other content is added to or removed from the document. The ContentRunsCollection class is the container for all such content.
Pictures and Shapes which are anchored to a specific location within the document can be added to a paragraph using the Anchors collection.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Documents.Word.Document
member.summary: Encapsulates a word processing document.

remarks.p: The Document class represents the root level of the object hierarchy. It serves as a container for block-level content such as paragraphs and tables.
Block-level content is contained within the ContentBlocks collection; paragraphs and tables can be added to a document using the AddParagraph and AddTable methods, respectively.
Properties of the document such as author, title, and subject can be specified using the DocumentProperties property.
Default formatting attributes for all content within the document can be defined using the DefaultFont, DefaultParagraphProperties, and DefaultTableProperties properties.

Pagination properties such as page size, page orientation, and margins, can be defined using the FinalSection property and the Sections collection. The FinalSection property returns an object with which the developer can specify pagination properties for the entire document. The Sections collection provides a way to define document sections for groups or block-level content. When the Sections collection contains one or more members, the FinalSection defines the pagination for the block-level content in the document which follows the last block for which a section is explicitly defined.

Headers and footers can also be added to the document, using the HeaderAllPages, FooterAllPages, HeaderFirstPageOnly, and FooterFirstPageOnly properties of the section. Headers and footers can contain the same block-level content as the document itself; content is written to the headers/footers using the identical syntax as is used when writing main document content (headers and footers expose a ContentBlocks collection, which is the same type as the ContentBlocks collection exposed by the Document).

The developer can use the Unit property to change the implied unit of measurement for the property get and set methods at any time during the lifetime of the document without affecting the actual values. For example, when setting font sizes the property can be set to 'Point', and then changed to 'Inch' or 'Centimeter' when setting indentation or line spacing, and any previously set values will remain as they were.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.Word.Document.Save(System.String)
member.summary: Saves the contents of the document to a file in the MS Word2007 document format.
member.param: The complete path to the destination file. Note that if the file extension is omitted, the DefaultFileExtension is used.

remarks.p: The output produced by this method can be consumed by a WordprocessingML that supports the MS Word2007 format, or an application which supports the WordProcessingML specification.

member.summary: Restores all property values to their respective defaults, and clears the contents of all collections.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.Word.Document.ToString
member.summary: Returns the string representation of this instance.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.Document.ContentBlocks
member.summary: Returns a collection of ContentBlock-derived objects, such as paragraphs or tables, which comprise the block-level content for this document.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.Document.DocumentProperties
member.summary: Returns an object which contains information about this Document such as title, author, subject, etc.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.Document.HasDocumentProperties
member.summary: Returns a boolean value indicating whether the object returned from the DocumentProperties property has been created, and whether any of its properties are set to non-default values.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.Document.DefaultFont
member.summary: Returns Font object which applies to all characters in this document with no more specific setting.

remarks.p: The properties of the instance returned by this property define the font attributes for all text runs within the document which do not have a font explicitly defined.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.Document.DefaultParagraphProperties
member.summary: Returns a ParagraphProperties instance which defines the properties for paragraphs which do not have properties explicitly defined.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.Document.HasDefaultParagraphProperties
member.summary: Returns a boolean value indicating whether the object returned from the DefaultParagraphProperties property has been created, and whether any of its properties are set to non-default values.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.Document.DefaultTableProperties
member.summary: Returns a DefaultTableProperties instance which defines the properties for tables which do not have properties explicitly defined.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.Document.HasDefaultTableProperties
member.summary: Returns a boolean value indicating whether the object returned from the DefaultTableProperties property has been created, and whether any of its properties are set to non-default values.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.Document.FinalSection
member.summary: Returns a DocumentFinalSection instance which defines properties such as page size, margins, and orientation for the final section of the document.

remarks.p: The instance returned from this property defines the pagination for all content in the document that does not belong to a section.
In the case where no sections are defined for any paragraph or table in the document, this property defines the pagination for the entire document.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.Document.NewLineType
member.summary: Returns or sets a value which determines the method used to represent a newline in the generated output.

remarks.p: The newline character(s) can be represented as either a line break or a carriage return. A document consumer may interpret a line break or carriage return differently depending on the circumstances under which it is used. For example, paragraph justification can behave differently in MS Word depending on whether a line break is contained within the paragraph. A carriage return is recognized in a standard paragraph as a line-breaking character, but is not recognized when the paragraph is contained within a table cell.

This property can be used to specify the method used to represent a newline for all text runs within the document. The AddNewLine method overload which takes a NewLineType parameter can be used to generate a newline character independently of the value of this property. The TextRun class also exposes a NewLineType property, so that the newline character can be specified on a per-TextRun basis.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.Document.Sections
member.summary: Returns a collection of Section instances which define the pagination for specific parts of the document.

remarks.p: The The Sections collection provides a way to define sections for a range of ContentBlocks, rather than for the entire document. For example, if a member is added to the Sections collection for the third paragraph in a document, the pagination for that section applies to the first three paragraphs in the document. Pagination for the remainder of the content in the document is then defined by the FinalSection.

Each member of the Sections collection defines pagination for the content block with which it is associated, and the content blocks which precede it. For example, if one section is defined for the third paragraph in the document, and another one for the fifth, pagination for paragraphs four and five are defined by the second section, and pagination for paragraphs one, two, and three by the first one. Pagination for all paragraphs following the fifth one in this case is defined by the FinalSection.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.Document.Unit
member.summary: Returns or sets a value indicating the implied unit of measurement for properties which represent graphical quantities.

remarks.p: The default unit of measurement for the properties which represent graphical quantities is the desktop publishing point, which is equivalent to 1/72 of an inch. This property can be changed to redefine that unit of measurement, so that graphical properties can be interacted with using units that are most comfortable to the end developer.

All property values are stored internally as twips (twentieths of a point), and coverted as appropriate in the property's get and set method implementations. The value of the Unit property can be changed at any time by the developer without affecting previously persisted property values.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Documents.Word.SectionHeaderFooter
member.summary: Base class for headers and footers.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.SectionHeaderFooter.ContentBlocks
member.summary: Returns a collection of ContentBlock-derived objects, such as paragraphs or tables, which comprise the block-level content for this header/footer.

remarks.p: Headers and footers can host the same content as the main document, i.e., paragraphs and tables.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Documents.Word.SectionHeader
member.summary: Encapsulates the header which appears at the top of a section.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Documents.Word.SectionFooter
member.summary: Encapsulates the footer which appears at the bottom of a section.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Documents.Word.Paragraph
member.summary: Encapsulates a paragraph within the document.

remarks.p: Use the AddTextRun method to add a run of text to the paragraph.
Use the AddHyperlink method to add a hyperlink to the paragraph.
Use the AddInlinePicture and AddInlineShape methods to add an image or shape to the paragraph, which appears in line with the textual content.
Use the AddAnchoredPicture and AddAnchoredShape methods to add an image or shape to the paragraph, which are anchored to a specific location within the document.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.Word.Paragraph.#ctor(Infragistics.Documents.Word.Document)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the class.
member.param: The Document with which this instance is associated.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.Paragraph.Anchors
member.summary: Returns a collection which contains the anchored content for the associated Paragraph.

remarks.p: Textual content, and content that appears "inline" with text, is added to the paragraph via the ContentRuns collection. Anchored content, such as pictures and shapes, can be added to the paragraph by adding members to the Anchors collection. The members of this collection are stationary; they do not flow along with the textual content, but rather remain at a fixed location within the document.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.Paragraph.ContentRuns
member.summary: Returns a collection which contains the inline content for the associated Paragraph such as text, hyperlinks, inline pictures, and inline shapes.

remarks.p:
All textual content for the paragraph is added via the ContentRuns collection. The collection also contains content which appears "inline" with the text; such content is not anchored to a specific location within the document, but rather flows along with adjacent text. Examples of such content are:
hyperlinks
inline pictures
inline shapes

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.Paragraph.Properties
member.summary: Returns a ParagraphProperties instance which defines the properties of this Paragraph.

remarks.p: The object returned from this property provides a way to change things like alignment, indentation, and line spacing for the paragraph.

member.summary: Sets a customized string identified by the specified string resource name.
member.param: Name of the string resource to customize.
The customized string. If null this has the same effect as calling

Arguments supplied to the string.Format method when formatting the string.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Documents.Word.SectionBase
member.summary: Base class from which the Section and DocumentFinalSection classes derive.

remarks.p: The pagination for all content associated with a document section can be customized using the SectionProperties object returned by the Properties property. Use this object to define the page size, margins, and orientation for the section.
Headers and/or footers can be specified for a section using the HeaderAllPages, HeaderFirstPageOnly, FooterAllPages, and FooterFirstPageOnly properties.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.SectionBase.HeaderFirstPageOnly
member.summary: Returns a SectionHeader instance which encapsulates the content which appears in the header for the first page in the associated Section.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.SectionBase.HeaderAllPages
member.summary: Returns a SectionHeader instance which encapsulates the content which appears in the header for all pages in the associated Section.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.SectionBase.FooterFirstPageOnly
member.summary: Returns a SectionFooter instance which encapsulates the content which appears in the footer for the first page in the associated Section.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.SectionBase.FooterAllPages
member.summary: Returns a SectionFooter instance which encapsulates the content which appears in the footer for all pages in the associated Section.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.SectionBase.Properties
member.summary: Returns a SectionProperties instance which defines the properties of this Section.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Documents.Word.Section
member.summary: Encapsulates the pagination properties and header/footer content for a document section.

member.summary: Returns the Paragraph or Table associated with this instance.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.Section.Document
member.summary: Returns the Document associated with this instance.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Documents.Word.DocumentFinalSection
member.summary: Encapsulates the properties of the final document section.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Documents.Word.SectionsCollection
member.summary: Contains the Section instances which define pagination for specific portions of the associated Document.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.Word.SectionsCollection.Add(Infragistics.Documents.Word.Table)
member.summary: Adds a Section which defines pagination for the specified Table and all content blocks which precede it.
member.returns: A reference to the Section that was added.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.Word.SectionsCollection.Add(Infragistics.Documents.Word.Paragraph)
member.summary: Adds a Section which defines pagination for the specified Paragraph and all content blocks which precede it.
member.returns: A reference to the Section that was added.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.Word.SectionsCollection.Contains(Infragistics.Documents.Word.Paragraph)
member.summary: Returns a boolean value indicating whether an element associated with the specified Paragraph instance exists in this collection.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.Word.SectionsCollection.Contains(Infragistics.Documents.Word.Table)
member.summary: Returns a boolean value indicating whether an element associated with the specified Paragraph instance exists in this collection.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.Word.SectionsCollection.Contains(Infragistics.Documents.Word.ContentBlock)
member.summary: Returns a boolean value indicating whether an element associated with the specified ContentBlock instance exists in this collection.

member.summary: Removes the element associated with the specified paragraph.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.Word.SectionsCollection.Remove(Infragistics.Documents.Word.Table)
member.summary: Removes the element associated with the specified table.

member.summary: Removes all elements from this collection.

member.summary: Returns the number of items in this collection.

member.param: The table associated with the section to be returned.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Documents.Word.Table
member.summary: Encapsulates a table within the document.

remarks.p: A table is a block of content which contains rows and cells. Rows are added to the table using the Rows collection.
The number of columns within the table is determined by the number of elements in the Columns collection.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.Word.Table.#ctor(Infragistics.Documents.Word.Document)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the class.
member.param: The Document with which this instance is associated.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.Table.Columns
member.summary: Returns a collection of TableColumn instances which comprise the columns which appear within this table.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.Table.Rows
member.summary: Returns a collection of TableRow instances which comprise the rows which appear within this table.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.Table.Properties
member.summary: Returns a TableProperties instance which defines the properties of this Table.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Documents.Word.TableCell
member.summary: Encapsulates a cell within a row.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Documents.Word.TableContent
member.summary: Base class for the TableRow, TableColumn, and TableCell classes.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.TableContent.Document
member.summary: Returns the Document with which this item is associated.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.TableContent.Index
member.summary: Returns the ordinal position of this item within the collection to which it belongs, or -1 if it does not belong to a collection.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.Word.TableCell.#ctor(Infragistics.Documents.Word.Document)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the class.
member.param: The Document with which this instance is associated.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.Word.TableCell.SetText(System.String)
member.summary: Assigns a simple text value to the cell.
member.param: The string to assign.

remarks.p: The SetText method provides a way to assign a simple text value to a table cell, without triggering creation of the ContentBlocks collection or a Paragraph.
To add more complex content such as text with mixed formatting attributes, hyperlinks, images, shapes, and tables, use the ContentBlocks collection.
Note that calling this method causes the contents of the ContentBlocks collection to be emptied.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.TableCell.CellsCollection
member.summary: Returns the TableCellsCollection to which this instance belongs, or null if this cell does not currently belong to a collection.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.TableCell.ContentBlocks
member.summary: Returns a collection of ContentBlock-derived objects, such as paragraphs or tables, which comprise the block-level content for this table cell.

remarks.p: Table cells can host the same content as the main document, i.e., paragraphs and tables.

Simple text can be assigned to a table cell using the SetText method. This method is extended as a convenience to the developer, so that the cell can display a textual value with no specific font attributes without incurring the overhead associated with triggering creation of this collection, as well as a Paragraph and a TextRun.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.TableCell.Properties
member.summary: Returns a TableCellProperties instance which defines the properties of this TableCell.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.TableCell.Row
member.summary: Returns the TableRow with which this cell is associated, or null if this cell is currently not associated with a row.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.TableCell.Table
member.summary: Returns the Table with which this cell is associated, or null if this cell is currently not associated with a table.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Documents.Word.TableCellsCollection
member.summary: Contains the cells which belong to a row.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Documents.Word.TableContentsCollection
member.summary: Base class for collections of types which derive from the TableContent class.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.Word.TableCellsCollection.Add
member.summary: Adds a new TableCell to the associated table.
member.returns: A reference to the TableCell that was added.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.Word.TableCellsCollection.Insert(System.Int32)
member.summary: Inserts a new TableCell into the associated table at the specified ordinal position.
member.param: The ordinal position within this collection at which to insert the row.
member.returns: A reference to the TableCell that was inserted.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.TableCellsCollection.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the TableCell instance at the specified ordinal position within this collection.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.TableCellsCollection.Row
member.summary: Returns the TableRow to which this collection belongs.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.TableCellsCollection.Table
member.summary: Returns the Table with which this collection is associated.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Documents.Word.TableColumn
member.summary: Encapsulates a column within a table.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.Word.TableColumn.#ctor(Infragistics.Documents.Word.Document)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the class.
member.param: The Document with which this instance is associated.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.TableColumn.ColumnsCollection
member.summary: Returns the TableColumnsCollection to which this instance belongs, or null if this column is currently not associated with a table.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.TableColumn.Table
member.summary: Returns the Table with which this column is associated, or null if this column is currently not associated with a table.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.TableColumn.PreferredWidth
member.summary: Returns or sets the preferred width for this column.

remarks.p: This property is only applicable when the Layout property is set to 'Fixed'.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Documents.Word.TableColumnsCollection
member.summary: Contains the columns which belong to a table.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.Word.TableColumnsCollection.Add
member.summary: Adds a new TableColumn to the associated table.
member.returns: A reference to the TableColumn that was added.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.Word.TableColumnsCollection.Insert(System.Int32)
member.summary: Inserts a new TableColumn into the associated table at the specified ordinal position.
member.param: The ordinal position within this collection at which to insert the row.
member.returns: A reference to the TableColumn that was inserted.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.TableColumnsCollection.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the TableColumn instance at the specified ordinal position within this collection.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Documents.Word.TableRow
member.summary: Encapsulates a row within a table.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.Word.TableRow.#ctor(Infragistics.Documents.Word.Document)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the class.
member.param: The Document with which this instance is associated.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.TableRow.Cells
member.summary: Returns a collection of TableCell instances which comprise the cells in this row.

remarks.p: Because one TableRow can contain a different number of cells than another TableRow in the same Table, the Cells collection is not connected with the Columns collection of the associated table, and must be explicitly populated.
If the Columns collection of the associated Table contains fewer elements than this Cells collection, the additional cells are displayed after the cell which corresponds to the last column.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.TableRow.RowsCollection
member.summary: Returns the TableRowsCollection to which this instance belongs.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.TableRow.Properties
member.summary: Returns a TableRowProperties instance which defines the properties of this TableRow.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.TableRow.Table
member.summary: Returns the Table to which this row belongs, or null if this row is currently not associated with any table.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Documents.Word.TableRowsCollection
member.summary: Contains the rows which belong to a table.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.Word.TableRowsCollection.Add
member.summary: Adds a new TableRow to the associated table.
member.returns: A reference to the TableRow that was added.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.Word.TableRowsCollection.Insert(System.Int32)
member.summary: Inserts a new TableRow into the associated table at the specified ordinal position.
member.param: The ordinal position within this collection at which to insert the row.
member.returns: A reference to the TableRow that was inserted.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.Word.TableRowsCollection.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the TableRow instance at the specified ordinal position within this collection.
